data.title: The find panel needs a "close" button
data.body:
~~This is both a question and a request.~~

~~The question is, how do I toggle the "find" panel? I know `Command-F` is the key shortcut for opening it, but what's the one for closing it?~~

~~The UI request is adding a :negative_squared_cross_mark: button on the panel. Even if the key shortcut is somewhere around (I can't find it), it's a good UI practice to have a visual option.~~

Please disregard the issue. I wanted to publish it at https://github.com/atom/find-and-replace and got mixed up.

data.title: Error after updating to 0.96 from 0.94
data.body:
After auto-updating to 0.96 and choosing to "install and restart" from the menu, I received the following error:

![error](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/139470/3042974/e721ebd4-e101-11e3-97d6-68bb9d9986df.png)

I also could no longer start the application from the Dock Icon..I had to restart it from the Applications folder.

OSX 10.9.3

Updating Atom from 0.94 to 0.96

Everything seems to be working now, but I just wanted to document this error.

data.title: Atom doesn't compile on FreeBSD11-amd64
data.body:
Compile log: http://sprunge.us/LhJN
Installed packages: http://sprunge.us/Vbic

Kernel is GENERIC-VT
World is FreeBSD11 stock
Instructions where followed from https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/docs/build-instructions/freebsd.md but Atom will not compile, it appears that FreeBSD compilation support hasn't been implemented or has been broken/removed for some reason. I will be happy to test any fixes, I am MistySolution or Thonneve on irc.freenode.com/#atom

data.title: Atom dosen't match the style of the native title bar's style.
data.body:
Atom dosen't match the style of the native Mac OS X title bar's style.

Either this can be "fixed" by intergrating the tabs in the title bar (like in Google Chrome) or by making the style bar black in the default theme (see [Zed](http://zedapp.org) and [Brackets](http://brackets.io) (both are built on JavaScript)).

I don't know if this is a issue with Atom-shell and not Atom.

_Thanks._

data.title: Atom text edit pane went unresponsive and then overwrote file with only my typed characters on save
data.body:
I was working in Atom 0.96.0 with a horizontal split screen. 1 file open at the top and 2 files in the bottom. When I went to select some text in the top pane the chrome developer console popped up. There was no error in the console, so I figured I must have triggered a shortcut. I closed the console and tried to select again. It wouldn't let me select or type or move the curser, but the curser was still flashing. I mashed the keyboard in an attempt to see changes on the screen. When nothing worked, I closed the file and it prompted me to save my changes. Figuring it just got stuck on a keyboard shortcut or mouse gesture, I said save and then reloaded Atom. On reload I opened my file and it was just 8 characters, which I'm pretty sure were the keys I mashed after the window was unresponsive ('asdfasdf').

The only indication that Atom had issues was the developer console popping up. But there was no error in the console so no indication that anything was actually wrong. If there were some kind of error message or warning I would never have saved my work.

data.title: Word wrap and bracket highlight
data.body:
Minor bracket highlight issue:
![snapshot24](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1240012/3038804/cf5bbb08-e0d2-11e3-829b-8dfc39de1f42.png)

"Some random text here Some random text here {" is on the same line. It wraps the last symbol as should since the line doesn't fit the window width because of it, although Atom highlights that bracket at the wrong place then.

Behavior in the Kate editor:
![snapshot25](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1240012/3039017/ff498752-e0d5-11e3-8085-94e4234ff4e3.png)

data.title: Multiple user run
data.body:
When an instance of atom is running with the current user, running a second instance of atom with sudo does not make it run with root access.

Reproduce : 
$ atom
$ sudo atom

$ ps -aux | grep atom // shows no instance of atom with root user

Same problem in the opposite case.

data.title: CTRL+s does not work (Ubuntu)
data.body:
On Ubuntu (haven't tried others) the ctrl+s shortcut does not work. 
Ctrl+Shift+s does work though and others do too. It is configured in the settings (default)
- Ubuntu 14.04 (Gnome) 
- Atom version 0.97.0-22b932e [22b932e](compiled by Webupd8)

If more information is required, please let me know!

data.title: Use Atom-specific fork of React allowing selection restoration opt out
data.body:
The default version of React reads the current selection when an input element is focused during reconciliation. This happens on every keystroke in the React editor, causing an extra reflow. I have a PR open at https://github.com/facebook/react/pull/1439 to add the ability to opt out of this to React-proper, but until then, we'll have to use a fork. The PR comes from my account a few weeks ago, but the fork actually lives at https://github.com/atom/react/tree/selection-restoration-opt-out. It includes changes to `package.json` so it could be published that we wouldn't want to merge into React.

I'm not sure if this is the best approach structure-wise. The helper library `reactionary` depends on the requiring library having `react` available in its `node_modules`. So I published our fork of `react` as `react-atom-fork` and also published `reactionary-atom-fork` which requires `react-atom-fork` instead of `react`. Not beautiful but it works. Hopefully these fork packages are temporary.

data.title: Reopen Last Item behavior broken under OS X
data.body:
I've noticed this behavior from first install (0.94.0, I believe) and up to and including 0.96.0. To reproduce:
1. Open a file
2. Quit Atom
3. Launch Atom
4. Select Reopen Last Item – action fails
5. Select Open... and select another file

This file will display in a 2nd tab, while the file that should have opened with Reopen Last Item will display in the first tab in the same window.

data.title: Use React components for lines and line numbers
data.body:
This PR switches back to React components for lines and line numbers. There is a ~14% performance penalty at larger scroll sizes, but the code is a lot easier to reason about. I would love input from @petehunt or another member of the React team regarding improving the performance.

As you can see below, the overhead appears to be significant over the current manual DOM manipulation approach. The first part of the timeline is an accelerating scroll in two different versions of the editor, the first full react from this PR, the second with manual DOM manipulation from master. Note the larger amount of yellow JS time in the first timeline.

data.title: Delete key not working on Ubuntu
data.body: Built from source at 5690d9fe8151f51a96a0acef327abaf4e5e3eb0f. Everything else seems to be working fine, backspace too, but not the Delete key (works in other programs).

data.title: Use sudo for commands needing to copy within /tmp
data.body: Use `sudo script/grunt mkdeb` since it copies files within /tmp.

data.title: Atom Not in Start Menu after Windows Build
data.body:
I would make a pull request, but I'm not sure of the correct way to do this since the path to the Start Menu shortcuts differs on Win XP and newer Windows versions.

On Windows Vista, 7, & 8, it should be:

```
C:\ProgramData\Microsoft\Windows\Start Menu\Programs\Atom
```
###### While it is the default, it may not be `C:\` on some systems.

data.title: Open file from `Open With` dialog messes up file URL
data.body:
I opened a file from the `Open With` dialog in PCManFM. However, this messes up the file URL and thus causes the editor to open just an empty file.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/170947/3032736/9ac95dea-e05b-11e3-929b-804b00197807.png)

Basically it constructs an URL path in the form of:

`/home/<username>/file:/home/<username>...`

I am using the latest git version on Arch Linux.

Let me know if I can provide you with more information.

data.title: Don't use CSS animations to blink cursor in the React editor
data.body: I'm going to test this locally for a while, but I'm pretty sure that using a CSS animation for cursor blink is introducing weird delays when moving the cursor and typing. It's forcing a re-composite at 60 frames per second, which is about 30x more than required for a cursor that blinks 2x a second.

data.title: React editor: Issues with autocomplete-plus
data.body:
Hey,

I'm the creator and maintainer of the autocomplete-plus package. Since you are using React.js, I'm running into the following issue:

Before React, I was able to focus autocomplete-plus's hidden input field every time an autocompletion was triggered. Since all keyboard events bubbled up to the editor view (except for the ones defined in the keymap), I was able to receive keymap events and keep typing inside the editor at the same time.

Since you are using React, this is not possible anymore. It seems like autocomplete-plus's hidden input field is swallowing all keyboard events and the EditorView entirely loses focus. If I disable the React editor, it works fine.

Can you think of a reason for this?

I've been talking to @kevinsawicki about this before and he asked me to move the conversation to the GitHub issues :)

Best,
Sascha

data.title: Indent guides mess up with mixed indentation
data.body:
Definitely an odd situation that coders shouldn't be getting into I grant you, but if the indentation mode of the current file is tabs and the indentation actually mixes tabs and spaces, the indent guides go a bit funny:

![indent-guides](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/412784/3029068/6900d09c-e031-11e3-877f-3e534d303dda.gif)

(Similar with invisibles shown:)

![indent-guides-invisibles](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/412784/3029078/7bd675d2-e031-11e3-8cd1-552b3bc02e1a.gif)

Version 0.95.0. Will test with updated version later.

data.title: Editor Does Not Preview / Edit Files on Network Drive
data.body:
OS: Windows 7
Atom Version: 0.95.0-3f0640f

Hosting files on a network drive (i.e. \network\private\myfiles) and opening files in atom does not show anything.  Files list on left pane and a tab opens up in editor, but tab is empty and shows nothing.

Additional Note:  I tested using a mapped drive and it worked.  It appears there's an issue running atom in Windows and trying to open files on a network path.

data.title: Add Visual Studio 2010 SP1 download URL
data.body: Many people are confused by indicating just Visual Studio 2010 Express without SP1

data.title: installing atom from github url running command
data.body:
The instructions provided are...

  git clone https://github.com/atom/atom
  cd atom
  script/build # Creates application at $TMPDIR/atom-build/Atom
  sudo script/grunt install # Installs command to /usr/local/bin/atom
  script/grunt mkdeb # Generates a .deb package at $TMPDIR/atom-build

When I tried running script/build I got the error....
" /usr/bin/env: node: No such file or directory "

data.title: Double Keybinding for Go-To-Line and Find-Next-Result
data.body:
Under windows currently those both have the same keybinding. Either should the `'find-and-replace:find-next'` should have a more specific selector, so it only fires when the search pane is open or reassign another standard key.

Even after remapping the keys, the go-to-line keymap seems not working on win32.

Regards

data.title: Can't install behind HTTP proxy -- can't clone git:// URLs
data.body:
_Somebody_ is trying to `git clone` a `git://` url. Because of the proxy, I can only clone `http://` urls.

I configured `git` to translate the urls (thanks, @stefanpenner!):

``` bash
git config --global url."https://".insteadOf git://
```

-- but even so, the problem remains...

``` bash
$ script/build 

Removing envify ✓
Installing modules ✗

> atom@0.97.0 preinstall /home/tfga/temp/atom
> node -e 'process.exit(0)'


npm ERR! git clone git://github.com/atom/slick.git Cloning into bare repository '/home/tfga/.atom/.node-gyp/.atom/.apm/_git-remotes/git-github-com-atom-slick-git-fe3034e1'...
npm ERR! git clone git://github.com/atom/slick.git 
npm ERR! git clone git://github.com/atom/slick.git fatal: unable to connect to github.com:
npm ERR! git clone git://github.com/atom/slick.git github.com[0: 192.30.252.129]: errno=Connection timed out
npm ERR! git clone git://github.com/benogle/jsdiff.git Cloning into bare repository '/home/tfga/.atom/.node-gyp/.atom/.apm/_git-remotes/git-github-com-benogle-jsdiff-git-b9e372e4'...
npm ERR! git clone git://github.com/benogle/jsdiff.git 
npm ERR! git clone git://github.com/benogle/jsdiff.git fatal: unable to connect to github.com:
npm ERR! git clone git://github.com/benogle/jsdiff.git github.com[0: 192.30.252.129]: errno=Connection timed out
npm ERR! Error: Command failed: fatal: unable to connect to github.com:
npm ERR! github.com[0: 192.30.252.129]: errno=Connection timed out
```

I realize there's another issue with (almost) the same name (#2297), but the problem there seems to be different (having to do with npm).
